The Trestle Troll might be an ugly monster,

Posted By: cardswithoutsleeves (9/28/2012 3:00:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I was surprised to find that this is the first creature EVER printed to have both reach and regenerate. Very few other spider-type blockers can hold off your opponent's dragon/demon/angel/whatever every turn and live. Even the list of flying regenerators is pretty short; it stands at about 25 right now -and that includes some massive guys like [Devouring Strossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Devouring Strossus) and [Hellkite Overlord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hellkite Overlord) who really don't serve the same defensive role. For that reason, I think at 2.845 this card's currently a little bit underrated.
posts.html:
I was surprised to find that this is the first creature EVER printed to have both reach and regenerate. Very few other spider-type blockers can hold off your opponent's dragon/demon/angel/whatever every turn and live. Even the list of flying regenerators is pretty short; it stands at about 25 right now -and that includes some massive guys like Devouring Strossus and Hellkite Overlord who really don't serve the same defensive role. For that reason, I think at 2.845 this card's currently a little bit underrated.

Posted By: Morgaledh (11/11/2012 7:55:11 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is one of the cards you try to use and no matter how you try to make it useful, you can't.  
3 mana to regenerate is too much. Would be so good if it was 0/1 with ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) to regenerate.  
I liked this card when I opened RTR boosters. Lost many games trying to use it.  
[Deadly Recluse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deadly Recluse) is all you need to defend flyers. And that can attack too.  
My rating: 2/5   
Artwork: 4,5/5  
Flavor text: 4/5
